title: Teen facing charges in shooting after juvenile shot in Nashua home
content:
NH1.com
NASHUA - A man is facing charges after a juvenile was shot in a downtown home.
Christopher Baxter, 19 of no fixed address, was identified as a suspect after an ambulance was called for a juvenile suffering a gunshot wound on Saturday night. The victim was taken to a local hospital for non-life-threatening injuries, and later transfered toa Boston hospital for more care.
Baxter was arrested Sunday and charged with reckless conduct, a class B felony, as well as falsifying physical evidence - also a class B felony.
He could face 14 years in prison and is being held on $100,000 bail. He is scheduled to appear in court on Monday.
